name: Petra Moon Hotel

reviews.text: Family room with was great layout and very comfortable. Rooms were clean and beds perfect.
reviews.title: Great rooms & location - do not book tours through hotel

reviews.text: Buffet dinner in restaurant was average but good value. Bread pudding-like dessert was fantastic. They don’t serve alcohol in this hotel.
reviews.title: Family trip

reviews.text: Staff was very helpful and friendly. Wifi did not work in lobby or rooms and when it did it was so slow that it was useless. Probably an ISP issue rather than the hotel.
reviews.title: location, location, location!

reviews.text: Booked a trip to Wadi Rum through the hotel and coordinated with the hotel Manager. Things started off OK but after arriving in Wadi Rum, things fell apart. I paid for a 4 hour tour. The camel ride was much shorter than promised and then the jeep tour was an hour less than agreed to. On top of this the whole tour started at 11am but the guide did not bring with any lunch (and you cannot buy lunch anywhere) so by 2pm my family was starving. After a number of calls between the Petra Moon Manager, the tour operator, the taxi driver and the jeep driver, they all agreed that there was a miscommunication and they could take us back into Wadi Rum for an hour. By this point is was too late and completely impractical. Suggest booking with a reputable tour operator rather than through the hotel.
reviews.title: Close to Petra entrance gate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good hotel right nect to Petra with warm and friendly staff. The rooms were very clean with excellent service. It had easy access to the main attractions around and the ambience of the hotel was very nice. It is very reasonabley priced as well. Would definetely recommend for families to stay. But its only a 3 star hotel so dont have high hopes!
reviews.title: My Feeling about this Hotel is Mixed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at the Petra Moon Hotel for one (1) night during our two (2) day tour in Jordan. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly, and the rooms spacious and spotless. The dinner and breakfast buffets were exceptional, and the room rate was very reasonable.
reviews.title: Wonderful Small Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel for both business and leisure travelers who want to stay close to the entrance of the Petra National Park as the Ticket Office/Entrance is only several hundred yards from the Petra Moon Hotel.
reviews.title: Overrated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited Petra in February which is off-season and stayed 2 nights at the Petra Moon Hotel. The hotel staff were relatively helpful and the food was okay. When we arrived we entered our room to an awful paint fume smell. I thought we would get used to it but 2 hours later I could still smell it. When we asked to move rooms, we were told that all rooms had that smell. Among other complaints the tv was not in working order and we had to call down to have them fix it, and the shower would only ever reach a luke warm temperature.
reviews.title: Ideal location, good room rates

reviews.text: The perks of this hotel is it's proximity to the entrance of Petra. A mere 2 minute walk down the hill and you're at the visitors center.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel
Max Convenience food & sites & Hotel Comforts
reviews.text: Went on a spontaneous 2 night trip to explore Petra as BA had a great special offer from Heathrow to Amman in December 2012. Found and booked the hotel online. We could also conveniently requested an airport pickup directly on the online reservation form.

The Petra Moon Hotel is conveniently located a few minutes from the entrance to the Petra Archaeology Site and many shops and restaurants. We enjoyed the friendliness of the staff, the breakfast that was included, and the hospitality "perks" (fruit basket and candy bars). The staff was extremely friendly and gave a partial refund when it was pointed out that the room at the end of the hallway had no wi-fi and the water was lukewarm. Overall, it was a very pleasant stay and would definitely recommend this hotel to travelers.
reviews.title: Friendly Hotel with Great Location

reviews.text: Excellent room. Good breakfast. We had a great dinner. Clean. I would stay again.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only negatives were small. First, the decor is perhaps not superbly elegant, but, certainly very nice. Second, I asked the manager for a taxi and the rate to Wadi Ram. He said JD 60. Then, I told him a taxi at the stand in front of Petra's entrance had quoted me JD 35. He said that is a good price. The lesson learnt is that he is on his countrymen's side. I got a taxi from the stand and went to Wadi Ram for JD 35. Just don't believe his first quoted rate :-)
reviews.title: Great hospitality, food, and facility

reviews.text: But, as I said, this hotel looks new, has a great location, great food and generally nice service. You can't go wrong if you don't ask them to call you a taxi :-)
reviews.title: No need to go anywhere else.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful and comfortable room with good quality bedding and furnishings. A level of hospitality and service that is rarely seen any more. Very elegant dining room with good breakfast and dinner buffets and very attentive service.
reviews.title: Great service and perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was quite satisfied with my stay here. The beds were comfortable, the service was friendly and the breakfast and dinner buffets were very tasty. There were just a few things that I think needed improvement:
reviews.title: Pleasant hotel close to the entrance of Petra

reviews.text: - A couple of service requests were forgotten
reviews.title: Clean and comfortable with a great location!

reviews.text: - The double bed was actually two single beds
reviews.title: Best thing is just location

reviews.text: - Water from the bath tap was too slow to fill the bath (only important since it was snowing at the time!!)
reviews.title: Very comfortable, locally owned

reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights at the Petra Moon in December. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable with excellent beds and nice cozy comforters. Our room also had a wonderful view! The staff were really nice and helpful and always quick to respond to requests. It's only about a 5 minute walk over to Petra, which was extremely convenient. We loved this hotel and it would be my first choice on a future visit to Petra!
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

description: Petra Moon Hotel is newly reopened with an endless variety of four star services. The rooms of five star amenities, all day dining room, shuttle service from the hotel to all different destinations in Jordan and vice versa. The location of the hotel can tell you a story for being very close to the entrance of the ancient city of Petra. The Sky Roof Terrace and Restaurant offers a variety of cocktails and snacks. The hotel has a roof swimming pool surrounded overlooking Sharrah Mountains.
